summary.span: Provides a strongly typed collection for objects and implements the interface to support navigating through the collection.

span.span: Provides a strongly typed collection for objects and implements the interface to support navigating through the collection.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 類別會提供強類型的集合物件。The class provides a strongly typed collection for objects. 它會儲存內部中以零為起始的陣列物件。It stores objects internally in a zero-based array. 您可以修改集合時建立的第一個，然後使用下列方法來新增，請複製和移除物件：You can modify a collection when it is first created, and then use the following methods to add, copy, and remove objects: - 若要新增物件，使用， ，和方法。To add objects, use the , , and methods. - 若要複製物件，使用方法。To copy objects, use the method. - 若要移除物件，使用方法。To remove objects, use the method. 您可以建立唯讀，其中不允許新增、 複製或移除物件，使用靜態方法。You can create a read-only , which does not permit adding, copying, nor removing objects, by using the static method. 所傳回的集合並方法是唯讀的因此在時所傳回上存取屬性從傳回的物件提供者。The collections that are returned by the and methods are read-only, as is the that is returned when the property is accessed on a object that is returned from a provider. A會擲回例外狀況，如果您嘗試修改唯讀設定的預設索引子屬性，或使用下列方法之一：A exception is thrown, if you attempt to modify a read-only by setting the default indexer property or by using any of the following methods: - - - - - - 使用屬性檢查之前呼叫上述清單中的任何一種方法的集合。Use the property to check the collection before calling any of the methods in the preceding list. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範如何建立集合，然後新增物件使用方法。The following code example demonstrates how to create a collection, and then add objects to it using the method. 是目前的站台對應，顯示只有前兩個的階層層級的子集。The is a subset of the current site map, showing only the first two hierarchical levels. span.para: 方法可讓實作者定義執行基礎的標準行為時，必須執行的處理序物件。藉由定義方法，實作者可以將功能加入繼承的方法而不需要覆寫所有其他方法。具體而言，方法會呼叫隨時透過參考使用集合介面。

The method allows implementers to define processes that must be performed when executing the standard behavior of the underlying object. By defining the method, implementers can add functionality to inherited methods without having to override all other methods. Specifically, the method is called anytime the collection is used via a reference to an interface.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 您可以測試是否集合是唯讀的方式是檢查屬性。You can test whether a collection is read-only by checking the property. 屬性也會傳回`true`當處於唯讀狀態。The property also returns `true` when a is read-only. ## Examples 下列程式碼範例示範如何使用測試屬性是否集合是唯讀或可修改。The following code example demonstrates how to use the property to test whether a collection is read-only or modifiable. 如果`siteNodes`是可修改，`MoveNode`針對它呼叫; 否則即為複製品建立時，使用`siteNodes`做為基底。If `siteNodes` is modifiable, `MoveNode` is called on it; otherwise, a clone is created, using `siteNodes` as a base. [!code-csharp[System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection_1#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection_1/CS/webform1smccs.aspx#1)] [!code-vb[System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection_1#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/System.Web.SiteMapNodeCollection_1/VB/webform1smcvb.aspx#1)]

span.span: is .

span.para: 唯讀集合支援讀取和搜尋作業，但不支援， ， ， ， ，和方法，也不上的預設索引子 setter屬性， 。
A read-only collection supports read and search operations, but does not support the , , , , , and methods, nor the setter on the default indexer property, .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 列舉集合是本質上並非安全執行緒的程序。Enumerating through a collection is intrinsically not a thread safe procedure. 即使是同步處理，其他執行緒仍可修改，因而導致擲回例外狀況的列舉值。Even when a is synchronized, other threads can still modify the , which causes the enumerator to throw an exception. 若要保證列舉期間的執行緒安全，您可以鎖定在整個列舉期間或攔截由其他執行緒所做的變更造成的例外狀況。To guarantee thread safety during enumeration, you can either lock the during the entire enumeration or catch the exceptions resulting from changes that are made by other threads.
